title: Great Mosque of Djenné
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,654 words, Level Z1 (Grade 5+), Lexile 1130L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     N and W
description: Made entirely of mud brick, the Great Mosque of Djenné is one-of-a-kind. Not only is it unique, but It is also the largest mud-built structure in the world. Located in Mali in West Africa, the history of the mosque dates back centuries, and has been completely rebuilt three times over its lifetime. This book introduces students to the mosque's fascinating history, and to the history of Islam in the region.
highFrequencyWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
